citing_paper_authors: Colin, Bannard | Timothy, Baldwin | Alex, Lascarides
raw_text: Baldwin et al (2003) use LSA as a technique foranalysing the compositionality (or decomposability) of a given MWE
clean_text: Baldwin et al (2003) use LSA as a technique foranalysing the compositionality (or decomposability) of a given MWE.

raw_text: Some of these are mutual information (Church and Hanks, 1989), distributed frequency (Tapanainen et al, 1998) and Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) model (Baldwin et al, 2003)
clean_text: Some of these are mutual information (Church and Hanks, 1989), distributed frequency (Tapanainen et al, 1998) and Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) model (Baldwin et al, 2003).

raw_text: Some of them are Frequency, Point-wise mutual information (Church and Hanks, 1989), Distributed frequency of object (Tapanainen et al, 1998), Distributed frequency of object using verb information (Venkatapathyand Joshi, 2005), Similarity of object in verb object pair using the LSA model (Baldwin et al,2003), (Venkatapathy and Joshi, 2005) and Lexical and Syntactic fixedness (Fazly and Stevenson, 2006)
clean_text: Some of them are Frequency, Point-wise mutual information (Church and Hanks, 1989), Distributed frequency of object (Tapanainen et al, 1998), Distributed frequency of object using verb information (Venkatapathyand Joshi, 2005), Similarity of object in verb object pair using the LSA model (Baldwin et al,2003), (Venkatapathy and Joshi, 2005) and Lexical and Syntactic fixedness (Fazly and Stevenson, 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Ngoc-Quynh, Do | Chung-chieh, Shan | Marco, Baroni | Raffaella, Bernardi
raw_text: Although the general focus in the area is to perform algebraic operations on word semantic vectors (Mitchelland Lapata, 2010), some researchers have also directly examined the corpus contexts of phrases. For example, Baldwin et al (2003) studied vector extraction for phrases because they were interested in the decomposability of multi word expressions
clean_text: For example, Baldwin et al (2003) studied vector extraction for phrases because they were interested in the decomposability of multi word expressions.

raw_text: Ac cording to Baldwin et al (2003), divergences in VPC and head verb semantics are often reflected in differing selectional preferences, as manifested in patterns of noun co-occurrence
clean_text: According to Baldwin et al (2003), divergences in VPC and head verb semantics are often reflected in differing selectional preferences, as manifested in patterns of noun co-occurrence.

raw_text: Prior work in discovering non-compositional phrases has been carried out by Lin (1999) and Baldwin et al (2003), who also used LSAto distinguish between compositional and non compositional verb-particle constructions and noun noun compounds
clean_text: Prior work in discovering non-compositional phrases has been carried out by Lin (1999) and Baldwin et al (2003), who also used LSAto distinguish between compositional and non compositional verb-particle constructions and noun noun compounds.

raw_text: Some of these are Frequency, Mutual Information (Church and Hanks, 1989), distributed frequency of object (Tapanainen et al, 1998) and LSA model (Baldwin et al, 2003) (Schutze, 1998)

clean_text: An interesting way of quantifying the relative compositionality of a MWE is proposed by Baldwin, Bannard, Tanaka and Widdows (Baldwin et al, 2003).

raw_text: They evaluate their model on English NN compounds and verb-particles, and showed that the model correlated moderately well with the Word net based decomposability theory (Baldwin et al, 2003)
clean_text: They evaluate their model on English NN compounds and verb-particles, and showed that the model correlated moderately well with the Word net based decomposability theory (Baldwin et al, 2003).

raw_text: LSA is a method of representing words/collocations as points in vector space. The LSA model we built is similar to that described in (Schutze, 1998) and (Baldwin et al, 2003)
clean_text: The LSA model we built is similar to that described in (Schutze, 1998) and (Baldwin et al, 2003).

citing_paper_authors: Mohammed, Attia | Antonio, Toral | Lamia, Tounsi | Pavel, Pecina | Josef, van Genabith
raw_text: Baldwin et al (2003 )classify MWEs, with respect to compositionality, into three categories: (a) non-compositional MWEs, where the expression is semantically impenetrable, such as hot dog, (b) idiosyncratically compositional, where the component words are forced to take semantics unavailable outside the MWE, such as radar footprint, and (c) simply composi 4In Arabic, the adjective follows the noun
Katz and Giesbrecht (2006) and Baldwin et al (2003) use Latent Semantic Analysis for this purpose
clean_text: Katz and Giesbrecht (2006) and Baldwin et al (2003) use Latent Semantic Analysis for this purpose.

clean_text: (Baldwin et al, 2003) use WordNet: :Similarity to provide an evaluation tool for multi word expressions that are identified via Latent Semantic Analysis.

citing_paper_authors: Scott S. L., Piao | Paul, Rayson | Olga, Mudraya | Andrew T., Wilson | Roger, Garside
raw_text: Baldwin et al (2003) proposed a LSA-based model for measuring the decomposability of MWEs by examining the similarity between them and their constituent words, with higher similarity indicating the greater decomposability
clean_text: Baldwin et al (2003) proposed a LSA-based model for measuring the decomposability of MWEs by examining the similarity between them and their constituent words, with higher similarity indicating the greater decomposability.

raw_text: To compare our method with that proposed by Baldwin et al (2003), we applied their method to our materials, generating LSA vectors for the component content words in our candidate MWEs and comparing their semantic similarity to theMWEs LSA vector as a whole, with the expectation being that low similarity between the MWE as a whole and its component words is indication of the non-compositionality of the MWE
clean_text: To compare our method with that proposed by Baldwin et al (2003), we applied their method to our materials, generating LSA vectors for the component content words in our candidate MWEs and comparing their semantic similarity to theMWEs LSA vector as a whole, with the expectation being that low similarity between the MWE as a whole and its component words is indication of the non-compositionality of the MWE.

raw_text: There is some evidence (Baldwin et al, 2003) that part of speech tagging might improve results in this kind of task
clean_text: There is some evidence (Baldwin et al, 2003) that part of speech tagging might improve results in this kind of task.
